entry.title: Seeking New Doctoral Students!
entry.content: The Interactive Audio Lab is seeking one or two new graduate students interested in working on making new eyes-free interfaces for audio production tools (e.g. mixers, digital audio workstations, audio editors). This is part of the exciting new NSF-funded project CHS: Medium: Next Generation Content Production Tools for People with Vision Impairments
entry.summary: The Interactive Audio Lab is seeking one or two new graduate students interested in working on making new eyes-free interfaces for audio production tools (e.g. mixers, digital audio workstations, audio editors). entry.title: October conference presentations
entry.content:
The Interactive Audio Lab travelled to New York this October all in New York!

Bongjun presented Sound Event Detection Using Point-Labeled Data at WASPAA 2019

Fatemeh presented Classifying non-speech vocals: Deep vs signal processing representations at DCASE 2019

Max presented OtoMechanic: Auditory automobile diagnostics via query-by-example at DCASE 2019
entry.summary: The Interactive Audio Lab travelled to New York this October all in New York!

entry.title: New NSF grant funding to build inclusive interfaces!

link.title: New NSF grant funding to build inclusive interfaces!

entry.content: We’re happy to announce the National Science Foundation has funded our grant CHS: Medium: Next Generation Content Production Tools for People with Vision Impairments
entry.summary: We’re happy to announce the National Science Foundation has funded our grant CHS: Medium: Next Generation Content Production Tools for People with Vision Impairments
